    • Method Detail

      • getPitchForNote

        public static float getPitchForNote​(int note)
        Returns the pitch float to be passed into Player#playSound, based off of an integer note value.
        Parameters:
        note - the note that should be played (0 is C4, 24 is C6, or something like that, it depends on the sample).
        Returns:
        the float representing the desired pitch.

      • toNoteSequence

        public static org.bukkit.Note[] toNoteSequence​(int[] notes)
        Converts a sequence of integers representing pitches to note objects.
        Parameters:
        notes - the sequence of integers to be converted (0-24 inclusive, negative numbers will be turned into null objects).
        Returns:
        the array of Note objects.

      • playSequence

        public static void playSequence​(org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin plugin,
                                org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                org.bukkit.Instrument instrument,
                                org.bukkit.Note[] notes,
                                int noteRate)
        Plays a sequence of notes at the given rate. Null values are not played and are treated as rests.
        Parameters:
        plugin - the plugin to play the notes on.
        player - the player that will hear the notes.
        instrument - the instrument that the notes will be played on.
        notes - the sequence of Note objects representing the note (use toNoteSequence for ease).
        noteRate - the rate at which the notes will be played at (in game ticks).

      • playSequence

        public static void playSequence​(org.bukkit.plugin.java.JavaPlugin plugin,
                                org.bukkit.entity.Player player,
                                org.bukkit.Sound sound,
                                org.bukkit.SoundCategory category,
                                float volume,
                                int[] notes,
                                int noteRate)
        Plays a sequence of sounds at the given rate. Works with sounds that are not technically notes. Negative note values are not played and are treated as rests.
        Parameters:
        plugin - the plugin to play the notes on.
        player - the player that will hear the notes.
        sound - the sound that the notes will be played with.
        category - the audio category that the sounds will fall under.
        volume - the volume of the sounds.
        notes - the sequence of integers representing the notes (-1 will be turned into a null object).
        noteRate - the rate at which the notes will be played at (in game ticks).
